text: Mitrella floccata is a species of sea snail in the family Columbellidae, the dove snails. This species is distributed in the Indian Ocean off Tanzania, Mozambique, and South Africa. ==Subspecies== There are two subspecies: * Mitrella floccata floccata (Reeve, 1859) * Mitrella floccata hanleyi (Deshayes, 1863) ==Description== The shell length varies between 10 mm and 16 mm. ==References== * Spry, J.F. (1961). The sea shells of Dar es Salaam: Gastropods. Tanganyika Notes and Records 56 * Kilburn R.N. (1970). Taxonomic notes on South African marine mollusca, I. Annals of the Cape Provincial Museums 8(4):39–48 * Kilburn R.N. & Marais J.P. (2010) Columbellidae. pp. 60–104, in: Marais A.P. & Seccombe A.D. (eds), Identification guide to the seashells of South Africa. Volume 1. Groenkloof: Centre for Molluscan Studies. 376 pp. floccata Category:Gastropods described in 1859
title: Mitrella floccata
